code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'kwb.waterParcel' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/kwb.waterParcel")

title:
Random concentrations in all samples based on measured data and assumed
deviation — get_all_sample_concentrations
text: input_table Data frame reshaped function reshape_table() predictor_samples character vector names samples used predicting substance concentration remaining samples. tracer_names vector character strings defining tracers used MCS_runs number random samples drawn (Monte-Carlo-Simulation runs) rel_deviation Either one numeric value 0 1 defining standard deviation relative measured value tracers vector length 'tracer_names' defining deviation tracer

title: Loads CSV-Data table — load_lab_data
text: CSV table must contain one row per measurement standard column names defined details section

title: Loads CSV-Data table — load_lab_data
Loads CSV-Data table — load_lab_data
text: path filepath file filename including ".csv" ending

title: Loads CSV-Data table — load_lab_data
text: data frame corresding csv file, date columns specified POSIXct

title: Loads CSV-Data table — load_lab_data
text: Required table column names: sample_name: unique ID  sample (least unique per sampling campaign) sampling_campaign: unique ID sampling campaign tBeg: starting time sample (format: "YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS") tEnd: ending time sample (format: "YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS") operator: definition LOD-relation (either "<", ">" empty) value: measured value parameter: unique name measured parameter (parameter used column name reshaping table, start number contain special symbols spaces) unit: unit measured value

Transforms tracer concentrations into normalized values between 0 and 1 — normalize_MCS_input
text: MCS_input list sample Data frames created get_all_sample_concentrations()

title: Transforms tracer concentrations into normalized values between 0 and 1 — normalize_MCS_input
text: structured list input normalized values instead absolute concentrations

title: Transforms tracer concentrations into normalized values between 0 and 1 — normalize_MCS_input
text: Normalization per tracer equation:  (c_i - min(c)) / (max(c) - min(c))  results values 0 (equals overall minimal value tracer within samples) 1 (equals overall maximal value tracer within samples).

text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
Reshape Data to Parameter-as-Columns-Structure — reshape_table
text: function keeps columns "sample_name", "sampling_campaign", "tBeg", "tEnd" adds one column per parameter. operators taken account.

title: Reshape Data to Parameter-as-Columns-Structure — reshape_table
Reshape Data to Parameter-as-Columns-Structure — reshape_table
text: df_in Data frame loaded load_lab_data() sampling_campaigns One sampling Campaign IDs considered bLOD Character string defining handling operator "<" (limit detection). Either "half" dividing value 2, "zero" "na" setting value 0 NA, respectively. aLOD Character string defining handling operator ">" (limit detection). Either "double" multiplying value 2, "use_limit" using limit value "na" setting value NA.

title: Reshape Data to Parameter-as-Columns-Structure — reshape_table
text: data frame data per sample row, arranged starting time sample.
